src:
Tapal Batas
Mengintip Jalur Pedesaan di Krayan Nunukan
04 Nov 2019, 01:53 by Pradita Utama
 Nunukan - Krayan adalah nama wilayah di Kabupaten Nunukan, Kalimantan Utara. Di sebagian wilayah tersebut masih terdapat infrastruktur jalan yang berupa tanah merah.



Seperti inilah jalan di pedesaan Krayan, Nunukan, daerah perbatasn Indonesia-Malaysia yang materialnya masih berupa tanah merah.
 



Pengendara sepeda motor melintas di jalan yang masih berupa tanah merah yang masih berada di sekitar kawasan pemukiman.
 



Jalan tersebut tentunya akan berdebu saat musim kemarau dan menjadi becek disaat musim hujan.
 



Wilayah Krayan sendiri dikelilingi oleh hutan khas Kalimantan yang masih lebat nan hijau.
 



Tempat tinggal suku Dayak Lundayeh ini berbatasan langsung dengan Malaysia tepatnya di Desa Long Midang.
 



Bersamaan dengan Program Nawacita yang diusung Presiden Jokowi, Krayan sudah mulai bergerak ke arah perubahan. Tentunya perubahan menjadi lebih baik. Salah satunya adalah pengerjaan akses jalan yang dapat ditembus melalui Kabupaten Malinau.
 



Saat tim tapal batas detikcom menyambangi daerah perbatasan tersebut, Jalanan tampak berdebu saat dilintasi oleh kendaraan, terutama mobil.
 



Jalan di penghubung Desa Long Bawan juga ada yang kondisinya sudah mulai mulus dan bagus. Jalan tersebut sudah dibeton sesuai dengan program pemerintahan Jokowi.
text:
Boundary
Peek at the Rural Track in Krayan Nunukan
Nov 04 2019, 01:53 by Pradita Utama
Nunukan - Krayan is the name of the region in Nunukan Regency, North Kalimantan. In some of these areas, road infrastructure in the form of red earth is still present.



This is the way in the Krayan countryside, Nunukan, an Indonesian-Malaysian border area whose material is still in the form of red earth.




Motorcycle riders cross the road which is still in the form of red dirt that is still around the residential area.




The road will certainly be dusty during the dry season and become muddy during the rainy season.




The Krayan region itself is surrounded by typical forests of Borneo which are still thick and green.




The residence of the Dayak Lundayeh tribe is directly adjacent to Malaysia in the village of Long Midang.




Along with the Nawacita Program carried by President Jokowi, Krayan has begun to move towards change. Of course, change for the better. One of them is the work of access roads that can be penetrated through Malinau District.




When the detikcom boundary team visited the border area, the streets looked dusty when crossed by vehicles, especially cars.




Roads connecting the village of Long Bawan also have conditions that have begun to smooth and good. The road has been concreted in accordance with Jokowi's administration program.
